overview_of_class: This course discusses key ideas, theories, and actors (e.g., institutions, social movements, NGOs, governments, etc.) that have shaped mainstream and alternative development processes and practices. It examines the ways in which discursive, political, and economic aspects mutually reinforce power structures that determine which people do and do not count as "developed" and which perspectives on change become part of development processes.
name: Advanced Topics Sociology
title: DOHA SOCIOL 387-0-70 Advanced Topics Sociology
enrl_requirement: Enrollment Requirements: Registration is reserved for NU Qatar Juniors and Seniors Only

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: This course discusses key ideas, theories, and actors (e.g., institutions, social movements, NGOs, governments, etc.) that have shaped mainstream and alternative development processes and practices. It examines the ways in which discursive, political, and economic aspects mutually reinforce power structures that determine which people do and do not count as "developed" and which perspectives on change become part of development processes.

descriptions.name: Registration Requirements
descriptions.value:
• Prerequisites: None

  • Open to juniors and above

  • Open for cross-registration

subject: SOCIOL
